description.narrative: To restore and improve housing and public services in targeted communities of Odisha, and increase the capacity of the State entities to respond promptly and effectively to an eligible crisis or emergency.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :BeMC Quality Consultant | Description :BeMC to select and hire a quality consulting audit firm to certify timingand quality standards of infrastructure improvement works, as well as contractors performance and compliance with regulatory andsafeguards requirements. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Contractors’ Safeguards Obligations | Description :Odisha shall include compliance with the Safeguard Documentsas part of the contractors’ obligations pursuant to the bidding documents. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Governmental Permits – Compensation/Relocation Assistance | Description :Odisha to ensure that prior tocommencing any civil works: (i) all governmental permits and clearances have been obtained, and pre-construction conditions imposedhave been met; and (ii) all resettlement compensation and relocation assistance has been paid/provided. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Consultant | Description :BeMC to select and hire the services of a Project implementationconsulting firm to assist BeMC PIU to carry out the day-to-day implementation of Component 2 and Sub-component 4.1 of the Project .| Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Units-I | Description :Odisha to vest the implementation responsibilities for: (i) Components 1,3 and Sub-Component 4.1 of the Project, on the R&DM Department, acting through OSDMA; and (ii) Component 2 and Sub-Component 4.2 ofthe Project, on the H&UD Department, acting through BeMC. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Implementation Units-II | Description :Odisha to maintain a state level Project steering committee for policyguidance and general oversight. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Units-III | Description :Odisha to establish, and thereafter maintain: (i) a PMU, a central PIUand four district-lev implementation units within OSDMA for the day to day implementation of Components 1, 3 and Sub-Component 4.1of the project ; (ii) a PMUs within H&UD Department and a PIUwithin BeMC for the day to day implementation of Component 2 andSub-Component 4.2 of the project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Ineligible Expenditures | Description :Odisha to pay any land purchase/acquisition, and resettlementcompensation payments out of its own resources. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Internal Auditors | Description :OSDMA to select and hire the services of (a) firm(s) of chartered accountant inorder to carry out internal audits of the operations of OSDMA’s, H&UD Department’s and BeMC’s implementation units | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Procurement Complaints Mechanism | Description :Odisha shall establish a mechanism for handling procurementcomplaints with a second tier appeal system and complaint database providing free and public access for the submission ofelectronic claims. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Procurement Disclosure | Description :Odisha shall establish and maintain a freely and publicly accessibleprocurement database and record keeping system showing updatedprocurement information (i.e. notices, bidding invitations, requestfor proposals, awards, etc.). | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Documents | Description :Odisha to implement the Project in accordance with the Project OperationsManuals, the Safeguard Documents and the Housing Reconstruction Guidelines, and refrain from amending, suspending, waiving and/orvoiding any of those documents without the prior concurrence of the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Resilient Housing – Eligibility of Housing Sub-Grants | Description :Odisha to reimburse IDA the amountsdisbursed under housing sub-grants agreements (Housing Sub-grants and Construction Incentives) for any unfinished housing or, ahousing which does not meet the required quality standards. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Resilient Housing – Selection of Beneficiaries | Description :Odisha to select beneficiaries for housingreconstruction activities pursuant to the guidelines and selection criteria set forth inthe Project Operations Manual. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Resilient Housing – Sub-grant Agreements | Description :Odisha to enter into sub-grant agreements under termsand conditions acceptable to IDA with those selected beneficiaries that opt to build their own houses, which agreement will requiretheir compliance with Safeguard Documents, architectural standards and specifications, tranche releases of funds upon verificationof construction milestones, and acceptance of random visits. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguard Instruments - Reporting | Description :OSDMA and BeMC shall submit to IDA a compilation of thesafeguards screening reports prepared for Project activities . | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Safeguard Reporting & Monitoring | Description :OSDMA and BeMC shall: (i) maintain monitoring and evaluationprotocols and record keeping procedures to supervise and assess compliance with Safeguard Documents; and (ii) to report onquarterly basis on compliance with Safeguard Documents. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Screening of Activities – Government Permits/Clearances and Social & Environment | Description :OSDMA and BeMCto refrain frm inviting bids, selecting contrs., undertaking preparatory works, or issuing Housing Sub-grant until/unless: (i)respective activities screened as per ESMF and whenever requd. the necessary EMP or RAP prepared; (ii) the safeguard docshave beendisclosed at least 15 days prior to the respective bidding invitations, grant issuance or initiation of contractor selection. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Social Mobilization Agency(ies) and Quality Audit Consultant | Description :Odisha (through OSDMA) to select,hire the services of: (i) a social, technical support agency(ies) for surveying of benef. about housing pref., and coordination andtraining for housing construction and development of village development plans (ii) qulty. audit consulting firm to certifyconstruction milestones, compliance with safeguards requirements, qulty. construction guidelines and standards | Frequency:CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Suggestion & Complaint Mechanism | Description :Odisha to establish and maintain/operate a grievance redressmechanism. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Funds immediately available to respond to a major disaster
Decision Support System established in OSDMA
Integrated complex comprising of OSDMA, GIS cell, Emergency Operation Center and a training established.
Number of Village Development Plans completed
People in urban areas provided with access to "improved sanitation facilities" under the project
People in urban areas provided with access to all-season roads within a 500 meter range under the project
State departments making use of OSDMA generated information.
City-wide drainage and sewerage master plans completed
People in urban areas provided with access to "improved water sources" under the project
Number of people with access to improved public services in Berhampur
Percentage of households with fully / severely damaged houses in project areas provided with resilient housing reconstructed under the project.
